historical:
Legislative History of Laws

For D.C. Law 13-293, see notes following ยง 16-4601.01.

Uniform Law

This section is based upon ยง 301 of the Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement Act (1997 Act). See 9, Part IA, Uniform Laws Annotated, Master Edition, or ULA Database on Westlaw.

DC CODE ยง 16-4603.01

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: "Petitioner" means a person who seeks enforcement of an order for return of a child under the Hague Convention on the Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction or enforcement of a child-custody determination.

"Respondent" means a person against whom a proceeding has been commenced for enforcement of an order for return of a child under the Hague Convention on the Civil Aspects of International Child Abduction or enforcement of a child-custody determination.

title.text: Particular Actions, Proceedings and Matters. (Refs & Annos)

chapter.text: Uniform Child-Custody Jurisdiction and Enforcement. (Refs & Annos)
